DataElement.preferredDefinition: an indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable related to the pre-existing condition of bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the pre-existing condition of bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel.:A health condition or medical problem that was diagnosed or treated before a specific date.

Concepts.definition: The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.
A health condition or medical problem that was diagnosed or treated before a specific date.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have active
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have active bleeding or pathologic conditions that carry high risk of bleeding such as known bleeding disorder, coagulopathy or tumor involving major vessels?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of hemorrhagic diasthesis or coagulopathy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had significant bleeding within 6 months of enrollment or any pathologic conditions that carry high risk of bleeding, such as known bleeding disorder, coagulopathy, or tumor involving major vessels?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had significant bleeding within 6 months of starting study therapy or any pathologic conditions that carry high risk of bleeding, such as known bleeding disorder, coagulopathy, or tumor involving major vessels?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active bleeding

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any pathologic condition that carries a high risk of bleeding, this includes Active bleeding (e.g. active hemoptysis within 2 weeks prior to registration or gastrointestinal bleeding within 3 months prior to registration), hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia (HHT), platelet function abnormality, autoimmune or hereditary hemolysis, coagulopathy, tumor involving major vessels?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any evidence of active bleeding or bleeding diathesis, or hemoptysis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have active bleeding or a pathologic condition that carries high risk of bleeding such as known bleeding disorder, coagulopathy or tumor involving (invading or encasing) major vessels?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any evidence of active bleeding or bleeding diathesis, or hemoptysis within 6 weeks prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have transfusion-dependent thrombocytopenia or a history of bleeding disorders of clinical conditions (e.g. GI bleeding or constitutional disorders) that may increase risk of life-threatening bleeding when thrombocytopenic?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have any evidence of active bleeding or bleeding diathesis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active bleeding, intratumoral hemorrhage, or bleeding diathesis

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Evidence of bleeding diasthesis or coagulopathy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: Hereditary or acquired coagulopathy (e.g., hemophilia, von Willebrand disease, or cancer associated DIC)

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of coagulopathy or bleeding diathesis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active bleeding?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have underlying hematologic issues including congenital bleeding diathesis, known previous GI bleeding requiring intervention within the past 6 months, history of hemoptysis with 42 days prior to study enrollment, active pulmonary emboli, or deep vein thrombosis (DVT) that are not stable on anticoagulation regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient experience coagulopathy requiring correction [e.g. with use of fresh frozen plasma (FFP)] at the time of SOS diagnosis or during SOS treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have bleeding diathesis that requires anticoagulants or antiplatelet agents, including nonsteroidal anti inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs),  at the time of the scheduled resection that cannot be stopped for surgery

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: is the date of last event or diathesis less than or equal to 6 months of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient experience coagulopathy requiring correction with the use of fresh frozen plasma (FFP) or cryoprecipitate  at the time of SOS diagnosis or during SOS treatment?

DataElement.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Assessments Ind-3b 2958018v1 with VD ID#3506036 - Yes No Not Applicable Indicator - dbw
